text: My oldest daughter was born around the time this game was released, and I remember playing this song to her she always started crying. I know, not nice of me, but at least it's a proof what impact music have on humans, no matter the age. And if I am down like now it can make me cry as well...

text: The reason they decided to go with MMO's instead of singleplayer games were because of piracy. Or so they claim. I say it's about time to get back on the adventure game horse especially now that steam is so dominant and easy to distribute from.

text:
maybe it doesn't have many puzzles like the first TLJ, maybe this game is easy and quite short, but my god, the story is so beautiful I can't describe it with words, I cried and fell in love with Zoe :D the ending scene is the one that stands next to the Sniper Wolf death in MGS or hotel scene in Silent Hill 2... AWESOME !!!

text:
I played this game a while ago, I don't remember the particulars but I know I really enjoyed it except that the ending was a gigantic cliffhanger and seeing as how it came out on the xbox and a sequel hasn't been made yet...

Though this is actually apparently a sequel itself to a game just called The Longest Journey that I believe only came out from the PC.
